subject: Economics
title: GDP Per Capita: The Flawed Yardstick of Progress
description: A micro-lesson that makes GDP Per Capita: The Flawed Yardstick of Progress usable.

hook.text: Qatar has the world's highest GDP per capita at $88,000.

buildup.text: GDP per capita: total economic output divided by population.

discovery.text: GDP doesn't capture inequality, health, education, freedom, or happiness.

twist.text: Robert Kennedy said GDP 'measures everything except that which makes life worthwhile.

climax.text: GDP per capita is useful but insufficient.

punchline.text: GDP tells you how much a country produces.

quiz.question: What does GDP per capita fail to measure?
options: Inequality, health, education, freedom, environmental quality, and well-being
